trans-unit.source: Update Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)
trans-unit.target: Update Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)

trans-unit.source: You can update an existing data source using an HTTP PUT request.
trans-unit.target: You can update an existing data source using an HTTP PUT request.

trans-unit.source: You specify the name of the data source to update on the request URI:
trans-unit.target: You specify the name of the data source to update on the request URI:

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="62ffee0b-ae3b-46c1-9ddb-a372d21c6f4d" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service Versioning</link> has details, including more information about alternative versions.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>api-key</languageKeyword> must be an admin key (as opposed to a query key).

trans-unit.source: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.
trans-unit.target: Refer to the authentication section in <link xlink:href="b298ac63-7b92-48cd-afe2-828538c47ca9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure Search Service REST API</link> to learn more about keys.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Create an Azure Search service in the portal</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/articles/search-create-service-portal/</linkUri></externalLink> explains how to get the service URL and key properties used in the request.

trans-unit.source: The request body syntax is the same as for <link xlink:href="1c9399cf-e3f6-466f-8a00-73ea27ca18f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.
trans-unit.target: The request body syntax is the same as for <link xlink:href="1c9399cf-e3f6-466f-8a00-73ea27ca18f8" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Create Data Source (Azure Search Service REST API)</link>.

trans-unit.source: For a successful request: 201 Created if a new data source was created, and 204 No Content if an existing data source was updated
trans-unit.target: For a successful request: 201 Created if a new data source was created, and 204 No Content if an existing data source was updated

trans-unit.source: Some properties cannot be updated on an existing data source.
trans-unit.target: Some properties cannot be updated on an existing data source.

trans-unit.source: For example, you cannot change the type of an existing data source.
trans-unit.target: For example, you cannot change the type of an existing data source.
